t: Jeremiah 30
The*p word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord,*s saying,
Thus*p speaketh the Lord*s God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

For,*p lo, the days come, saith the Lord,*s that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the Lord:*s and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
And*p these are the words that the Lord*s spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
For*p thus saith the Lord;*s We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
Ask*p ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
Alas!*p for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
For*p it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord*s of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
But*p they shall serve the Lord*s their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

Therefore*p fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord;*s neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

For*p I am with thee, saith the Lord,*s to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
For*p thus saith the Lord,*s Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.
There*p is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

All*p thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.
Why*p criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

Therefore*p all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
For*p I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the Lord;*s because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

Thus*p saith the Lord;*s Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob's tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.
And*p out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
Their*p children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

And*p their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the Lord.*s
And*p ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
Behold,*p the whirlwind of the Lord*s goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
The*p fierce anger of the Lord*s shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.
